from pyspark import SparkContext
# Create SparkContext
#sc = SparkContext("local", "CSV to RDD")

# Read CSV file into RDD
rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")

# Show RDD elements
rdd.take(5)

def replace_quotes(line):
    return line.replace('"', '')
   
    

# Apply function using map()
replaced_rdd = rdd.map(replace_quotes)


# Show transformed RDD elements
#data_rdd = replaced_rdd.collect()
replaced_rdd.take(5)

from pyspark.sql.types import *
schema = StructType([
    StructField('name', StringType(), True),
    StructField('school', StringType(), True),
    StructField('fees', IntegerType(), True),
    StructField('age', IntegerType(), True),
    StructField('place', StringType(), True)

header = replaced_rdd.first()

# Filter out the header from the data
data_rdd = rdd.filter(lambda line: line != header)

# Create DataFrame using withColumnRenamed to set header
df = data_rdd.toDF(header)

# Show DataFrame
df.show()

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

# Create SparkSession
spark = SparkSession.builder.appName("RDD to DataFrame with Header").getOrCreate()

# Example RDD with header and data
rdd = spark.sparkContext.parallelize([
    ('1', 'Alice', 25),
    ('2', 'Bob', 30),
    ('3', 'Charlie', 35)
])

rdd.take(5)

# Your list of strings


# Splitting the header and data
header = data_rdd[0]
data = data_rdd[1:]

# Split each line by comma and create Row objects
split_data = [line.split(',') for line in data]
rows = [Row(*line) for line in split_data]

# Create DataFrame with inferred schema
df = spark.createDataFrame(rows, header.split(','))

# Show DataFrame
df.show()
df.printSchema()

from pyspark import SparkContext
    # Create SparkContext
    #sc = SparkContext("local", "CSV to RDD")

    # Read CSV file into RDD
    rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")
    def rdd_to_df(rdd):
        def replace_quotes(line):
            return line.replace('"', '')
   
    
        # Apply function using map()
        replaced_rdd = rdd.map(replace_quotes)


        # Show transformed RDD elements
        data_rdd = replaced_rdd.collect()





        # Splitting the header and data
        header = data_rdd[0]
        data = data_rdd[1:]

        # Split each line by comma and create Row objects
        split_data = [line.split(',') for line in data]
        rows = [Row(*line) for line in split_data]

        # Create DataFrame with inferred schema
        df = spark.createDataFrame(rows, header.split(','))
        df = df.withColumn('fees',df.fees.cast('int')).withColumn('age',df.age.cast('int'))
        df.printSchema()
        df.show()

end_time = time.time()

# Calculate time taken
elapsed_time = end_time - start_time
print(f"Time taken: {elapsed_time} seconds")

from pyspark import SparkContext
# Create SparkContext
#sc = SparkContext("local", "CSV to RDD") vefv

# Read CSV file into RDD
rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")
def rdd_to_df(rdd):
    def replace_quotes(line):
        return line.replace('"', '')
   
    
        # Apply function using map()
    replaced_rdd = rdd.map(replace_quotes)


    # Show transformed RDD elements
    data_rdd = replaced_rdd.collect()





    # Splitting the header and data
    header = data_rdd[0]
    data = data_rdd[1:]

    # Split each line by comma and create Row objects
    split_data = [line.split(',') for line in data]
    rows = [Row(*line) for line in split_data]

    # Create DataFrame with inferred schema
    df = spark.createDataFrame(rows, header.split(','))
    df = df.withColumn('fees',df.fees.cast('int')).withColumn('age',df.age.cast('int'))
    df.printSchema()
    df.show()

rdd_to_df(rdd)
